description: This solicitation is for the removal and deconstruction of four (4) Vessels: quot;Western Star", quot;Haida Royal", quot;Tanner's Quest", quot;Montego Bay", and three (3) waste bins in Haida Gwaii, BC. The contractor will be required to remove, relocate, deconstruct, and dispose of the vessels and waste in a safe and environmentally responsible manner. The contractor will be required to follow all applicable regulations, use qualified personnel, and follow industry best practices. The contractor will be required to provide a report and photo documentation of the entire process from start to finish, and provide a detailed breakdown of costs* including (but not limited to) as indicated in the RFP. The contractor will be required to have appropriate personnel and equipment to remove, relocate, deconstruct, and dispose of the vessels and waste., • Separates waste streams (recyclables, garbage, hazardous material), • Dispose of all pollutants, contaminated materials, waste (hazardous, controlled or not) and debris in a manner compliant with all Federal, Provincial and Municipal laws and policies with documentation provided to substantiate this requirement, • Provide CCG with an invoice that includes a detailed breakdown of costs* including (but not limited to) as indicated in the RFP.
full_summary:
**Removal and Deconstruction of Western Star and Other Vessels, Haida Gwaii, BC**
================================噼================================

**Solicitation Information**
-------------------------

*   **Solicitation Number:** 30005140A
*   **Closing Date:** June 3, 2024
*   **Closing Time:** 2:00 PM (Eastern Time)

**Procurement Description**
---------------------------

The Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) is seeking a qualified contractor to remove, relocate, deconstruct, and dispose of four (4) vessels: Western Star, Haida Royal, Tanner’s Quest, Montego Bay, and three (3) waste bins in Haida Gwaii, British Columbia.

**Objectives**
-------------

The primary objective is to eliminate hazards to local marine and terrestrial environments by efficiently, safely, and environmentally responsibly removing the vessels. The contractor will follow industry best practices and all relevant regulations to ensure the successful completion of the project.

**Scope of Work**
----------------

The scope of work includes:

*   Removal and disposition of all vessels and waste, including hazardous materials, in compliance with federal, provincial, and municipal laws and policies.
*   Separation of waste streams, including recyclables and hazardous materials.
*   Provision of a detailed report and photo documentation of the entire process.
*   Completion of tasks within the specified timeframe, from June 10, 2024, to July 31, 2024.

**Security and Trade Agreements**
-------------------------------

*   No security requirements apply to this contract.
*   The requirement is subject to Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Contact Information**
----------------------

*   **Contracting Officer:** Gloria Tsaka Kipuni
    *   Email: <Gloria.TsakaKipuni@dfo-mpo.gc.ca>
    *   Phone: (343) 598-4182

**Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP)**

For complete details on the submission requirements, evaluation criteria, and other important information, please refer to the attached documents.

**Attachments**

*   [Evaluation Criteria](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/
